description:
The majority of sites were chosen from the Columbia_Basin_Master_Sample_20100411 shapefile found on the MonitoringResources.org website:  https://www.monitoringresources.org/Designer/Design/Index 

  • First created new feature class in the ThirtyMile.gdb to include only sites found on Thirtymile within the surveyed area (ThirtyMile_AllSites)
  • Used the 30MileSections shapefile (created from the GPS waypoints collected during the dry/wet survey) to populate fields in the sites shapefiles for what stratum each point fell on (Fenced/Perennial, Fenced/Ephemeral, Unfenced/Perennial, Unfenced/Ephemeral)

We were 1 site short in Unfenced Ephemeral section, so we had to create new sites.  For extra Unfenced Ephemeral Sites:

  • Split Dry/Wet line to isolate stream section of unfenced ephemeral creek (only 1.4 km)
  • Created a new shapefile with only this section
  • Created a new point feature class
    • Constructed points using isolated stream section and created points every 100 m starting at the downstream extent
  • Used this feature class to run grts sample design for finite resources in R to get ranking for sites in just Dry/Wet section.
targetPopulation: The target population of the John Day design was generally defined as the current Steelhead domain recognized by ODFW (John Day).  This follows the CHaMP domain of no 1st order streams, no intermittent streams, and gradient <12%, however the GIS frame was custom-made by ODFW and some exceptions to these rules may occur.

userSamples.name: Lower John Day (Thirtymile Creek) Habitat Surveys within the Columbia Habitat Monitoring Program (CHaMP) in 2017

title: Lower John Day (Thirtymile Creek) Habitat Surveys within the Columbia Habitat Monitoring Program (CHaMP)
